result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11:26 a.m.  Information filed. Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.

Adj. 11:27 a.m.

Order Denying Defendant's Motion for Bond Modification.
It is hereby ordered that the defendant's motion for bond modification is hereby denied.

10:32 a.m.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing; no inducement.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - scheduled for 8/25/22, 11:30 a.m., Br. 3.
BAIL MOTION - Argument by Atty. Dineen.  Argument by Atty. Vendetti for State.  Court denies motion.  State to draft order.

Arraignment scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 11:30 am.

1:59 pm - Prosecuting attorney Jordan W. Feest in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Darin J Garrison in court.  Attorney Nathan John Dineen in court for Darin J Garrison. Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held. Preliminary hearing is set for 07-28-22 at 10:30 a.m. Br. 3.
Preliminary hearing on July 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Adjustment Number: 22A 118247,
Payable Number: 156619,
Receipt Number: 22R 008456,
Amount: $20.00
Re:  Operate under influence (5th or 6th), on 05-29-22.
Order to report to MCSD for photo and prints

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of OWI causing injury (2nd + offense).  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 06-20-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 48 hours or, if incarcerated, within 72 hours of release, defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle, and defendant must maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs.    Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
